user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_post_process:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_post_process (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                  const char *post_data,
                  size_t post_data_len)
{
  if (0 == post_data_len)
    return MHD_YES;
  if (NULL == pp)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED)))
    return post_process_urlencoded (pp,
                                    post_data,
                                    post_data_len);
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA)))
    return post_process_multipart (pp,
                                   post_data,
                                   post_data_len);
  /* this should never be reached */
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
/* this should never be reached */
  return MHD_NO;
explanation: The only code fragment that suggests (and could actually be) unreachable is the final comment and return at the end of the function. The earlier explicit returns (for post_data_len == 0 and for NULL pp) and the two conditional returns that dispatch to post_process_urlencoded and post_process_multipart are legitimate reachable code paths and must remain to handle their respective runtime cases, so they do not by themselves indicate unreachable code. There is no other code in this function that is syntactically unreachable (all other statements can be executed depending on runtime inputs), so no additional fragments require investigation for Rule 2.1.
